metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2830 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
arch/x86/kernel/entry_64.S in the Linux kernel before 3.19.2 does notprevent the TS_COMPAT flag from reaching a user-mode task, which mightallow local users to bypass the seccomp or audit protection mechanism via acrafted application that uses the (1) fork or (2) close system call, asdemonstrated by an attack against seccomp before 3.16.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2830` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
